5.17.23  6:31 am   if you were to perform your songs live (i hope that happens btw), how many people would you need in your backing band and what instruments would you play personally

     there's many different ways to do it. anywhere from 3 to 12 people in the band. 12 people requires very strict arrangement. 3 would be all chemistry and improv. any more than 4 people would probably mean i would mostly only do vocal. it would be nice for people to trade instruments a lot. a lot of questions unanswered still

5.17.23  4:12 am   whats your favorite pizza

     show me a pizza that's almost impossible to believe

5.17.23  2:51 am   My list of song ideas, which are mostly just a few seconds of song each, is getting shockingly large. Like, it's well over a hundred, and I've only been collecting them for a year. I've written a few to completion, but it's always terrifying because I really really don't want it screw any of the songs up, because I kinda love all of them.

     that's understandable

      I hope to start recording stuff soon, but that's a stupidly large rabbit hole that I've yet to really touch. So.... what should I do?

     there are many good options here

      Should I stop everything and focus on writing more for the songs I have? Should I just focus on trying to record stuff? I'm not really sure exactly what direction to go in, and this whole thing is feeling like a crisis at this point

      talk it out, and you should start to see which way you want to go. new idea generation is always cool, you CAN continue to spend some time on that, however, if the guilt is killing you then you can suspend new gen for a while if it makes you feel more comfortable. If zero-record is k√illing you, then you can suspend all writing for a while if it makes you feel comfortable. Now, assuming you will record, choosing which one and which order is nearly impossible, especially for someone who 'cares' as much as i assume you do. I'm sure that every one of them has immense desire mixed with immense fear. this is normal. On one end of the spectrum, you could try to just go through the list and choose which one you 'fear the least', but this might actually make you pick the most boring one. You could do a brute force random, which means leave it to the computer to make a choice (count them up and randomize). And this may be a good idea but it also might not give you the best results. i've discovered that a hybrid method tends to work best for me, and it goes like this: go through your entire list, and pick out any one that excites you. and add those to a pre-selection list. And by the way, amount of writing completion shouldn't matter here. all of them are available, including ones at .01% writing. if it excites you, add it to the pre-selection list. Then, as soon as you finish the pre-selection list, immediately count them up and let the computer decide from there. and that's the choice. then finish the writing on that one, knowing it is the next one to be produced. then once the writing is done, then go into production. this hybrid method (half my choice, half random selection) has worked well for me for a long time, but, to be fair, that was long after i already figured out how to record a song. The problem i had earlier with recording songs is that it was too overwhelming, and what i actually had to do was write insanely short songs on purpose, so i could learn the ropes on everything quicker. so you might have to do that, if you are feeling overwhelmed with longer items. or who knows, maybe you won't be overwhelmed. but if you talk it out for a while, i'm sure you can come up with a great system that suits your needs. there are probably a million different schemes you could do, and the method you come up with can be something you are really proud of
